website_summaries.verdict: While it suffers at higher ISO sensitivity settings, the Kodak EasyShare Z885 is a surprisingly flexible, affordable camera.
cons: noise issues at ISO 800 and above

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z885 Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had three of these Z885's! My daughter liked mine for the quailty photos of the Grand Kid's sporting events, birthday parties and critter/insect close ups. She ran video and put 1440 photos on my SD card! So, I gave her mine and ordered another one from Amazon! I used mine for close ups/videos of operating machinery. I could e-mail the results to my Boss for claims adjustments. A neighbor kid dropped my daughter's Z885(1st) and broke it! I gave her mine(2) and have another Amazon Z885(3) on order. I kept my SD Card!!
customer_reviews.author: William E. Thom

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera so must that this is the second one I bought for my dad for father's day. It is very easy to use and take wonderful pictures right out of the box. The price makes it affortable for anyone and the soft wear is wonderful. You can do so much with your pictures for free with most of the soft wear and easy to use. You can upload and share big picture files that they can use for free to see and down load. I tell everyone about this camera and that Amazon has the cheapest price.
customer_reviews.author: Louise M. Di Carluccio

customer_reviews.title: A great camera !
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that I had to buy new batteries the day I got it but otherwise I find this camera very easy to use and the pictures turn out really good. I bought my first Kodak Easyshare in 2007 . I am a realtor and it's important to have a camera that works when you arrive at a listing to take pictures. I've always gotten rechargeable batteries. This camera came with regular batteries. It was a new camera but they were dead when it arrived. I replaced them and I'm very happy with how the camera has been working since.
customer_reviews.author: kathy santy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I have had mine for several years and recently helped a relative to buy it too.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Reid

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing but bad things to say about Kodak and the camera company ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked OK for a while. A few days after the warranty expired, the camera just stopped working. When I sent it in for repair, I was told that it had extensive water damage and I owed the repair company considerable money regardless if they could fix it, which they could not. I have nothing but bad things to say about Kodak and the camera company who does their repairs.
customer_reviews.author: saycheese

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for $99 and it is an excellent value. I takes great pictures and it's 8 mega pixels are enough for most pictures. My only complaint is it needs an optical viewfinder if pictures are to be taken in bright sunlight. It is difficult to see the LCD screen on bright sunny days. But under most conditions it works great. I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pattison

customer_reviews.title: Good camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy camera to use and functions well for digital photos as well as video. It transfers seamlessly to the computer and has stunning pixel display. I've only had this camera a few weeks but I really like it! When you transfer photos from camera to pc the software asks if you would like to delete all photos currently residing in your camera. The photo button trips quickly, which comes in handy when trying to capture those fast-moving kids!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Thomasson

customer_reviews.title: ... Gee thank you &" God Bless" ...
customer_reviews.text: ...Gee thank you &" God Bless" ya's for , for having this camera , Just thank you again......joyman@neo.rr.com
customer_reviews.author: John P. De Sarro

customer_reviews.title: Very Decent camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera works very well, pictures are of very good quality at 8 megapixels. One drawback is that when you remove the batteries for charging, it loses the date and has to be reset. Supposededly, a docking station (extra charge) eliminates the need to remove batteries. Also, there is no "Easy Share" if you are running older operating systems, like my Millenium Edition. Guess I now need a new computer to print or email my pictures. I suppose Walmart could at least do printing.
customer_reviews.author: Hans E. A. Schweikert

customer_reviews.title: I like this Camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this Camera a lot. The only thing I had a problem editing my video's with windows live movie maker.
customer_reviews.author: tjuana

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a birthday gift to my husband and he really liked it a lot. It wqorks the way he wants to and is small and portable.
customer_reviews.author: kindly friend

customer_reviews.title: I have not had any use from the camera yetn ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any use from the camera yetn as it has some bugs that I am trying to get worked out but no luck yet. It will only take 2/3 pictures part of the time. Ralph Rupe
customer_reviews.author: ralph rupe

customer_reviews.title: my easiest camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera........fits in my pocket and works very well for the pictures i take.....i like the software.............and i ordered some blow ups,they came out great...........
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tobiassen

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on three different Kodak cameras and this one by far was the best choice. The other two were the Z710 and the Z1285(12 MP). This camera is compact - which is what I was looking for - and it has all the features of the other two. The clarity of the pictures is incredible, and the menus are very easy to follow. The only drawback I find with the camera is that I seem to go through batteries fairly quickly, although not as fast as the 12MP model. Overall, I would highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Makadamia

customer_reviews.title: Very Picky about Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I use rechargeable batteries with this camera and I have to recharge them right before I use them on this camera every single time. I thought I just had crappy rechargeable batteries but I tried different brands and I get the same result. If I use batteries I charged 3 days ago it wouldn't work. It probably has something to do with Rechargeable batteries having 1.25V as opposed to Alkaline batteries having 1.5V. When I use Alkaline batteries, I have no problem. The Pictures come out great though... when it works.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but.....
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Z885 for a month. It is versatile and gives you a lot for the money. It has one glaring deficiency and that is the absence of a view-finder. I tried to take some beach and pool pictures in Florida. I could not make out an adequate image on the lcd and could not get good pictures. I would really like to see this camera at a slightly higher price and a view-finder.
customer_reviews.author: Rad63

customer_reviews.title: My 5th Kodak camera
customer_reviews.text: Yep, I stick with Kodak. I bought one of their first digital cameras and it still works, so I was confident in buying this one for my daughter for Christmas. She loves the ease of Kodak and the quality of the pictures. You'll be happy with any Kodak you buy, but do not buy them refurbished. We made that mistake. But new? You bet! author of:
customer_reviews.author: Judy Gregerson

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for six months and have been very disappointed. Almost every picture has red eye, some are grainy and the flash is useless. I have missed many important pictures because this camera does not work well inside. If you are taking pictures outside in bright sunlight it is excellent. If you are taking pictures of your children moving outside it is great. Sadly any picture taken indoor is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z885
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews I read before I purchased the Z885. The absence of a view-finder is a serious problem when taking pictures outside-especially if the sun is shining. You absolutely can not see what you are trying to take a picture of. Its really too bad because I like the number of pixels and the zoom is excellent. The camera takes great pictures inside and outside. Inside you can see your target fine; outside-you need to take a lot of extra shots to ensure you take the picture you want. Can't do that with grandkids,etc. Ok for static scenes outside (with extra shots). So, I am now looking for another camera.
customer_reviews.author: Boggie Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, for Steady Hands...
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this camera, I was very Excited. It captures with a professional style any photo, but it has serious problems with Motion Performances and specially with ISO-taken pictures. It looks a lot grainy and with extremely high noise. I tried everything to fix this, but is not possible. The video capturing is very good, and also the Smart Scene and Scenes Options are amazing. The Manual option is also great. The problem is Motion and ISO pictures. The Zoom its outstanding... For Semi-Prefessionals, I give it 3.8/5
customer_reviews.author: Milcka Carrera

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera for choice if money is the problem.It has many great features.There is a problem with taking a high ISO image between the shutter and the flash.The camera image will look jarred from the shutter opening and closing.The higher the ISO the Grainer the picture will become.Then again there is a bonus.35mm film cameras never had a ISO that high where the problem occurs,only cameras for fast motion were built for that.Took picture at 1600 ISO no problem.I have no problems with the camera myself.If i wanted a 1200.00 camera for that task i would have brought another one instead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Moores

customer_reviews.title: Kodak has outdone themselves
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. The picture quality is great, the video is amazing, I attempted to make a video of this review but after reviewing it, I decided that typing is what I am better at. I went to Sea World San Diego this past Saturday and tokk 97 pictures and even some video. I am still finding out the amazing things this camera can do. BEST INVESTMENT I HAVE EVER MADE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn L. Glass

customer_reviews.title: battery drainer
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera better than our old Kodak DX. It's smaller and faster. I like that the on/off is a separate button. With the DX, I have to go from auto mode to off to video mode. What I don't like about the Z885 is that it eats up batteries like crazy. I like taking pictures and videos of my kids. Many times, I miss the precious moments because the battery had drained.
customer_reviews.author: foofoo

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z885 review
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Kodak Z885 for my daughter. She has been interested in digital photography since using my Kodak D7630 camera. The camera is a birthday gift that was recieved with great enthusiasm. We both like the 5x optical zoom and easy operational steps. We were able to go through the features on the camera without a problem and are pleasantly impressed with the clearity of captured images.
customer_reviews.author: RayBoy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional camera. It takes high quality photos and is not short on extra features. I highly recommend it to beginners and point and clickers, however, Amazon has it WAY WAY overpriced at a whopping $400. Shouldn't pay more than $150 or so for it.
customer_reviews.author: Elegant Pride

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Point an shoot camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my aunt and uncle to replace their aging and slow DX4530 kodak this unit is a million times better as far as focus and shutter speed. Also the 5x optical zoom is a great benefit not usually found in cameras of this price range and works great. All in all I highly recommend this for the basic user as it is easy to use and creates beautiful photo's.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Marts

customer_reviews.title: We love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my husband. I thought since I already had a Kodak easyshare, that I would stick with what I know. He took it with him on his fishing trip and he loved using it. It makes great pictures! The price was right and I feel like I should replace my old camera very soon!
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Downlaoding pics to the computer - complicated
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the pics wasnt impressive at all....but downloading them to the computer was worse....it wasnt as friendly as with the previous cameras I used to have, Canon and Fuji. I would need to buy the dock to make d/l to pc easy, they at least should have sold it as an enissial accessory with the camera, included in the price.
customer_reviews.author: Maven

customer_reviews.title: Good item but bad LCD resolution
customer_reviews.text: A lot of function, easy to use, good quality of picturs, AA battery. Due to the low resolution of LCD, it cannot be a excellent one. Whenever checking the pictures in the LCD, You might always thought why you bought this one. But Pictures in your monitor and prints, there might be no more complains.
customer_reviews.author: Jaeho Park

customer_reviews.title: no wrist strap!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after my Sony of 4 years blew up. It does not compare in quality to my previous camera. The pictures taken inside were blurry and red-eyed. The colors in the NC mountains last week-end were vibrant! Too bad the camera didn't come close to capturing them. And-- WHAT'S THE DEAL WITH NO CARRYING STRAP!?? There's a place for one- but it is not provided- maybe it's considered an accessory along with the view finder-also not included. We'll probably end up buying another Sony and giving this to our teenager.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: The main problem I find is with an owner/operating manual. You download the CD rom Easy Share; some instructions are very clear, others are vague. If you are new to this type of camera and often refer to the operating manual it is incomplete and one must go to the Easy Share CD which presents a problem if away from your computer. So far, as I experiment with the Z885 I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: William Carr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a high end professional equipment, however I can't find any cons to bring up. Works good and a great value for the money. High quality images made in dark room.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Victor Tsan

customer_reviews.title: Camera Review
customer_reviews.text: This is simple easy to use camera. The telephoto lens is amazing, and the 8.1 mega pixel pictures are superb. I love this camera. Batteries seem to last and last. Threw my wifes old one away and brought her one of these. Super value for a low, low price.
customer_reviews.author: roy j hammond

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Z885
customer_reviews.text: I really love my new camera. I haven't had time to figure out all the quirks, but here goes: Good: Optical Zoom, Video recording, manual settings, can change pixel size, small, light weight, easy to use Bad: Cannot zoom when recording video, hard to capture moving objects in low light (concerts), software is very slow, must use software to load pictures from camera
customer_reviews.author: C. Pedotto

customer_reviews.title: Northern Wis review
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to use. It is the first digital camera I have own. I like the features where you can edit your pictures if they are not exactly what you want. Also the different settings for taking pictures in snow, with candles etc. very nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsinite

customer_reviews.title: Kodak Easy Share
customer_reviews.text: Camera has all of the features I wanted. It's easy to crop pictures, and their Easy Share program is great at downloading, enhancing, grouping pictures for printing on a PC, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tbonejoe

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the camera. Took it to Vegas. It took really GREAT pictures, even in low light and the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Lundberg

customer_reviews.title: EasyShare Z885
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would have image stabilization all the time but that is a mode all of it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: GREAT picture - BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes a GREAT picture, but it broke the first time it was used! I have sent it back to Kodak for repair, but that adds delay and additional cost! Hope the next one is repaired instead of just repackaged!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Dad

customer_reviews.title: EASY---Kodak Easy share Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy and great camera. It takes awesome pictures. Very user friendly. I like the small size. It easily fits in a pocket. Take it every where. I love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Gwenlyn L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Camera a few days ago and I have taken excellent photos with it. It is compact and has several interesting functions. It is cheaper than others but it is a Kodak. I like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Santos

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Brand new camera, cheaper on amazon than at kodak. received the package the week before christmas, less than 6 days promised. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K. Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Second Kodak Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kodak i have purchased. This is very easy to use and takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: MSJ

customer_reviews.title: helf
customer_reviews.text: please helf.I have kodak z885. i take good pictures, but when my digital camera dont switch on....I have this 4 week.
customer_reviews.author: tamuna55561

product_meta.title: Kodak Easyshare Z885 8.1 MP Digital Camera with 5xOptical Zoom
product_meta.description: Kodak 1685551 8.1 Megapixel Easyshare Z885 Zoom Digital Camera 8.0 Megapixels; 5x Optical Zoom; 2.5" Indoor/Outdoor Color Display; Perfect Touch Technology; Features Hi-Iso Mode, Digital Image Stabilization, Cropping, Histogram, Blurry Picture Alert & Digital Red-Eye Reduction; Video Print Options Including 4, 9 Or 16 Prints; 32 Mb Internal Memory & Secure Digital Card/Multimediacard Expansion Slot; 16 Scene Modes; Features Tv-Quality Video At 30 Fps; Includes Digital Camera, Aa Alkaline Digital Camera Batteries, Usb Cable, Neck Strap, Kodak Easyshare Software & Custom Camera Insert
feature_bullets: 8.1-megapixel sensor delivers excellent resolution for prints up to 30 by-40 inches
Record VGA (640 x 480) video at 30 fps with sound
Kodak Perfect Touch technology; Smart scene mode
32 MB internal memory; SD/MMC card slot

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars61 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
